critique: The document is a short statement regarding the appointment of Mrs. Liza B. Moncure to a classified position. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is likely joy or satisfaction that the widow of a fallen agent is being taken care of. There might also be an element of sadness due to the agent's death. There isn't much to suggest anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. The tone is formal and matter-of-fact.
